unnormalised: Gp. Capt. Varun Singh, a decorated officer, passed away earlier today at Command Hospital, Bangalore. The IAF pilot had sustained critical injuries in a chopper crash on 8th Dec, which also tragically claimed the life of CDS Gen. Bipin Rawat and others. He was initially undergoing treatment at Wellington's Military Hospital before being moved to Bangalore.
normalised: Group Captain Varun Singh, a decorated officer, passed away earlier today at Command Hospital, Bangalore. The I-A-F pilot had sustained critical injuries in a chopper crash on eighth December, which also tragically claimed the life of C-D-S General Bipin Rawat and others. He was initially undergoing treatment at Wellington's Military Hospital before being moved to Bangalore.

unnormalised: The entire nation mourns the loss of the brave officer. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh expressed his grief, stating, "Gp. Capt. Varun Singh served the nation with pride, valour and utmost professionalism. I am deeply anguished by his demise." He was known for his exceptional flying skills, earning him the Shaurya Chakra earlier in '21.
normalised: The entire nation mourns the loss of the brave officer. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh expressed his grief, stating, "Group Captain Varun Singh served the nation with pride, valour and utmost professionalism. I am deeply anguished by his demise." He was known for his exceptional flying skills, earning him the Shaurya Chakra earlier in twenty twenty one.

unnormalised: His sudden death comes as a huge blow to the Indian Air Force, especially considering the recent loss of the CDS. Condolences have been pouring in from all ranks, from Subedar Major to Air Chief Marshal, highlighting the impact Gp. Capt. Singh had on his colleagues and the institution. His legacy of courage and dedication will continue to inspire future generations.
